medical_history.chief_complaint: Severe weakness, dyspnea, and right lower extremity pain
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began 1 week prior to the visit, with increasing severity. The patient visited the emergency department 3 days before admission but was discharged with crutches. During this visit, hemoptysis was observed, and subsequent imaging revealed septic pulmonary emboli and cavitations.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Injected bath salts for approximately 1 month.
medical_history.social_history: Long history of drug abuse, specifically intravenous drug use with bath salts.
